techmeme.title: Google says it is "taking swift action" to remove AI Overviews on certain queries "where appropriate under our content policies" (Kylie Robison/The Verge)
Instant messaging client ICQ will stop working from June 26, recommends users migrate to messaging platforms from parent company VK; ICQ had 100M users in 2001 (Michael Kan/PCMag)
Atari buys the Intellivision brand and the rights to 200+ Intellivision Entertainment games, and says the deal "ends the longest running console war in history" (Todd Spangler/Variety)
An overview of existing deals between news publishers and AI companies and the questions they raise regarding long-term costs, the selection process, and more (Pete Brown/Columbia Journalism Review)
Google says the vast majority of AI Overviews provide high-quality information and many of the viral examples have been uncommon queries or have been doctored (Peter Kafka/Business Insider)
